be.docarch.odt2braille
Class Odt2Braille

java.lang.Object
  be.docarch.odt2braille.Odt2Braille

public class Odt2Braille
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a way to convert a flat .odt file to a .pef (portable embosser format) file. The conversion is done according to previously defined braille Settings. liblouisxml is used for the actual transcription to braille. A Checker checks the resulting braille document for possible accessibility issues.

Author:
Bert Frees
See Also:
liblouisxml

                   org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                   javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException,
                   javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Creates a new Odt2Braille instance. The Locale for the user interface is set to the default value.

Parameters:
flatOdtFile - The "flat XML" .odt file. This single file is the concatenation of all XML files in a normal .odt file.
liblouisDirUrl - The URL of the liblouis executable.
settings - The Settings that determine how the conversion is done.
statusIndicator - The StatusIndicator that will be used.
checker - The Checker that will check the braille document for possible accessibility issues.
odtLocale - The Locale for the document.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
org.xml.sax.SAXException

Method Detail

makePEF

public boolean makePEF(java.lang.String pefUrl)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                       javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException,
                       javax.xml.transform.TransformerException,
                       java.lang.InterruptedException,
                       LiblouisException
Converts the flat .odt filt to a .pef file according to the braille settings. This function
  • makes calls to Odt2Daisy.convertAsDTBook to convert the .odt file to multiple DAISY-like xml files,
  • uses liblouisxml to translate these files into braille, and
  • recombines these braille files into one single .pef file.
First, the document body is processed and split in volumes, then the page ranges are calculated and finally the preliminary pages of each volume are processed and inserted at the right places. The checker checks the DAISY-like files and the volume lengths. When a multi-volume feature is added to liblouisxml, this procedure of pef-creation might be simplified a lot.

Parameters:
pefUrl - The URL of the .pef file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
java.lang.InterruptedException
LiblouisException

runLiblouisxml

private void runLiblouisxml()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.lang.InterruptedException,
                            LiblouisException
Execute the xml2brl program. An xml-file is translated to a braille file. Before executing, liblouisxml has to be configured.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.InterruptedException
LiblouisException
See Also:
liblouisxml

configureLiblouisxml

private void configureLiblouisxml(boolean extractpprangemode,
                                  int beginPage)
Configure the xml2brl program.

Parameters:
extractpprangemode - true if the braille output will be used to extract the page range of the preliminary section.
beginPage - The first braille page number after this table of contents. If no table of contents is rendered, beginPage is just the first braille page number.
See Also:
liblouisxml
  • literaryTextTable, printPages, cellsPerLine and linesPerPage are set according to the braille settings.
  • Depending on extractpprangemode, an additional semantic-action file is added to semanticFiles.
  • beginningPageNumber is set to beginPage.
